page.title: 18LANGUAGE IN DUDLEY (1)
page.content: {Rahnd ere we spaeken different to {other folk}.The traditional 'language' spoken is the local Black Country dialect.Little-known or appreciated outside the area,it is an ancient dialect,many of whose words originate in the Anglo-Saxon language spoken before the Norman Conquest.It has been compared with the 14th century English language used in the works of Chaucer{ {an e wor ahf a bostin writer}. Also it is quite distinct from the Birmingham dialect with which 'outsiders' often confuse it.{We doe {spaek liark them over Brummagem. The best_known characters in local dialect are Aynuk and Ayli,two Black Country{blookes}about whom innumerable jokes and funny stories are told.
